Question
========
  
Suppose dummy coding is used in a regression to determine if two lesson programs, program A ($Prog_{A}$) and program B ($Prog_{B}$), are statistically significantly better than a current program, program C ($Prog_{C}$). The regression equation is: $Y’ = 55+(6*Prog_{A})–(4*Prog_{B})$. What is the mean score of the current $program_{C}$? 

Answerlist
----------
* 57
* 55
* 52
* 51

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* Incorrect
* Correct
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
